bwwExcerpt: Ain't Too Proud - The Life and Times of The Temptations is further proof, as if we need it, that the term "jukebox musical" just isn't fair - to jukeboxes. Feed a juke some cash and it delivers music, free of the blunt exposition that passes for librettos in so many of these stage biographies. Even with source material as glorious as "My Girl," "Just My Imagination," "Papa Was A Rolling Stone" and the song that gives this production its title, the result feels less celebratory than ruthlessly ef
